marklogic.body: I've had systemic lupus (and its horrors) for 16 years now. It robs you from your life. There is no cure, no specific medication for the illness. Doctors treat the symptoms. Meds are added on top of each other. You Reach the point you are thankful to be able to stand in the shower or get dressed in the morning. If you are lucky, you have a family who accepts the fact this illness isn't like the Flu. It doesn't go away after a few days or weeks. He's lucky to have support. I wish him well.
